chapter.title: Optimizing Performance
chapter.para: This chapter will focus on common performance issues and how to resolve them from the perspective of a Java programmer. The performance issues relating to design is out of scope of this chapter and will not be discussed.

note.para: In most of the cases, maintainability should be more important than performance. Between an algorithm which is a little slow but is easy to understand and an algorithm which executes faster but is hard to understand, you should choose the later. We should choose the former only when the performance is unacceptable to the users.

section.title: Investigating the root cause of performance issues
section.para: This section will show you how to find the cause of performance issues.
